medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset epigastric pain after eating.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began acutely around 12:30 PM today after eating; they reported abdominal distention and nausea and vomiting developed in the emergency room. The patient had a normal bowel movement at 1:00 PM with no change in pain. Vital signs were stable prior to transfer to the floor.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary Artery Disease s/p CABG, Diabetes Mellitus type II with polyneuropathy, Hypertension, Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia, Hypotestosteronism, Osteopenia, Thrombocytopenia, mild arthritis of the hands, history of herpes zoster, history of MRSA, and appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of breast cancer; Father died of heart disease. No gastrointestinal illnesses mentioned.
